books.title: Python para Desenvolvedores (2nd Edition)
books.author: Luiz Eduardo Borges
books.info: [PORTUGUESE] Este livro aborda assuntos que incluem: criação de interfaces com usuário, computação gráfica, aplicações para internet, sistemas distribuídos, entre outros.

books.title: How to Think Like a Computer Scientist: Interactive Edition
books.author: B. Miller & D. Ranum
books.info: This interactive book teaches you Python the interactive way, right in the browser.

books.title: Problem Solving with Algorithms and Data Structures Using Python
books.author: B. Miller & D. Ranum
books.info: This book is a CS2 data structures textbook, with a review of Python concepts in chapter 1

books.title: Learn Python The Hard Way
books.author: Zed A. Shaw
books.info: Have you always wanted to learn how to code but never thought you could? Do you want to challenge your brain in a new way?

books.title: Dive into Python (2004)
books.author: Mark Pilgrim
books.info: Dive Into Python is a free Python book (from 2004) for experienced programmers. It covers many basics of the language

books.title: Dive into Python 3
books.author: Mark Pilgrim
books.info: Dive Into Python 3 covers what's new in Python 3 and how its differs from Python 2.

books.title: Think Python
books.author: Allen B. Downey
books.info: A very exhaustive book covering most of the language features, from datatypes to OOP and debugging.

books.title: Kivy programming Guide
books.author: Kivy
books.info: Discover Kivy the multitouch Python framework for desktop and mobile, and learn how to create a simple game.

books.title: Django Tutorial
books.author: Community
books.info: With this hands-on tutorial, discover Django the popular high-level Python Web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.

books.title: Pyramid for Humans
books.author: Community
books.info: With this tutorial, discover Pyramid a Python web application development framework. Its primary goal is to make it easier for a Python developer to create web applications.

books.title: Flask microframework
books.author: Armin Ronacher
books.info: Learn the Flask web microframework by example. Flask aims to keep the core simple but extensible and gives you freedom to choose the libraries of your choice.

books.title: Making games with Python and Pygame
books.author: Al Sweigart
books.info: Making Games with Python & Pygame” covers the Pygame library with the source code for 11 games.

books.title: High Performance Python tutorial
books.author: Ian Ozsvald
books.info: In this 55 pages tutorial, Ian Ozsvald shows you a number of techniques to get a 10-500 performance increase in your Python apps, from profiling, to PyPy, numPy, Multiprocessing...

books.title: A byte of Python
books.author: Swaroop C H
books.info: This book aims to help you learn the wonderful Python language and show how to get things done quickly and painlessly - in effect 'The Perfect Anti-venom to your programming problems'.

books.title: Python 101 - Introduction to Python
books.author: Dave Kuhlman
books.info: This document is a syllabus for a first course in Python programming. This course contains an introduction to the Python language, instruction in the important and commonly used features of the language, and practical excercises in the use of those features.

books.title: The Standard Python Library
books.author: Fredrik Lundh
books.info: This book provides a brief description of each module of the +200 Python standard library and usage examples

books.title: Snake Wrangling for Kids
books.author: Jason R. Briggs
books.info: [DOWNLOAD REQUIRED] For children 8 years and older, who would like to learn computer programming. It covers the very basics of programming, and uses the Python programming language to teach the concepts.

books.title: Programming Computer Vision with Python
books.author: Jan Erik Solem
books.info: [PDF DRAFT] This book gives an entry point to hands-on computer vision (images, videos...) with enough understanding of the underlying theory and algorithms.

books.title: Natural Language Processing with Python
books.author: S. Bird, E. Klein & E. Loper
books.info: Practical introduction to programming for language processing, written by the creators of NLTK.

books.title: Think Complexity
books.author: Allen B. Downey
books.info: This book is about complexity science, data structures and algorithms, intermediate programming in Python, and the philosophy of science.

books.title: Think Stats
books.author: Allen B. Downey
books.info: Think Stats is an introduction to Probability and Statistics for Python programmers.

books.title: Python Module of the week
books.author: Doug Hellman
books.info: The Python Module of the Week series, or PyMOTW, is a tour of the Python standard library through short and concrete examples. It covers more than 50 modules.

books.title: An introduction to Python
books.author: John C. Lusth
books.info: A complete scholar overview of all Python 3 functionnalities from the Alabama University.

books.title: Building skills in Programming
books.author: Steven F. Lot
books.info: How do you learn to program? Through a series of simple exercises that teach programming fundamentals with an easy-to-use, easy-to-learn programming language.

books.title: Building skills in Python
books.author: Steven F. Lot
books.info: This 450+ page book has 42 chapters that will help you build Python programming skills through a series of exercises. This book includes six projects from straight-forward to sophisticated that will help solidify your Python skills.

books.title: Building skills in OOP
books.author: Steven F. Lot
books.info: How do you move from OO programming to OO design? This 301-page book has 49 chapters that will help you build OO design skills through the creation of a moderately complex family of application programs.

books.title: Python Scientific lecture notes
books.author: by the community
books.info: Teaching material on the scientific Python ecosystem, a quick introduction to central tools and techniques. The different chapters each correspond to a 1 to 2 hours course with increasing level of expertise, from beginner to expert.

books.title: Programmez avec Python 2
books.author: Gérard Swinnen
books.info: [FRENCH] Apprenez à programmer avec Python 2. Découvrez la programmation et le language Python grâce à cet ouvrage de référence.

books.title: Programmez avec Python 3
books.author: Gérard Swinnen
books.info: [FRENCH] Apprenez à programmer avec Python 3. Mise à jour du précédent ouvrage avec les spécificité de Python 3.

books.title: Python for you and me
books.author: Kushal Das
books.info: A book for the total new comers into Python world. Was started as book for students before they read Python tutorial.

books.title: Python course
books.author: Patrick Fuchs / Pierre Poulain,
books.info: [FRENCH] Beginner and progressive course about Python theory and concepts

books.title: Data Structures and Algorithms with Object-Oriented Design Patterns in Python
books.author: Bruno R. Preiss
books.info: This book is about the fundamentals of data structures and algorithms. It uses object oriented design patterns and teaches topics like stacks, queues, lists, hashing and graphs. There are also versions for other programming languages.

books.title: A bit of Python & other things.
books.author: Jesse Noller
books.info: A usefull page with good links to read about Python

books.title: Python Course
books.author: Google
books.info: This is a free class for people with a little bit of programming experience who want to learn Python.

books.title: Porting to Python 3: An in-depth guide
books.author: Lennart Regebro
books.info: This book guides you through the process of porting your Python 2 code to Python 3, from choosing a porting strategy to solving your distribution issues. Using plenty of code examples is takes you cross the hurdles and shows you the new Python features.

books.title: Non-Programmer's Tutorial for Python 3
books.author: Josh Cogliati/Wikibooks/Others
books.info: The Non-Programmers' Tutorial For Python 3 is a tutorial designed to be an introduction to the Python programming language. This guide is for someone with no programming experience.

books.title: The Hitchhiker’s Guide to Python!
books.author: Kenneth Reitz
books.info: This opinionated guide exists to provide both novice and expert Python developers a best-practice handbook to the installation, configuration, and usage of Python on a daily basis.
